page.title: 10LANGENHOE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Our{school}is 106 years old and it was damaged in the{Essex Earthquake}of {1884.}It needed tie rods on the walls to hold it together. In the winter of {1984}our roof was retiled. The workmen were to re-use as many of the old tiles as possible and so removed them very carefully. We found that as well as{Victorian}tiles, some of them were {Tudor,}taken from a building which was pulled down about the time the school was built. A local historian believes they were made locally as there is evidence that a kiln existed in another part of the village. The original school building had 2 classrooms. Nowadays we use one room as a classroom, hall and canteen and the other as a library, staff and T.V. room. As the pupil numbers have increased, we now have 2 relocatable classrooms in addition.
